Markdown Guide

Nov 17, 2022

Getting Started with Markdown

What is Markdown?

  • Easy-to-use markup language that converts plain text to HTML/XHTML

Why use Markdown?

  • Start writing with minimal training
  • Used in a variety of applications
  • Increasingly used in technical documentation
  • LaTeX conversion (KaTex) and other add-ins
  • UML diagrams
  • Jekyll, Jupyter Notebooks, Google Collab, R, Python, docs

Resources

  • Markdownguide.org (especially the cheat sheet and basic syntax)
  • There are a variety of useful Markdown editors
    • Typora (free)
    • Atom (free, open-source) [Sunset Dec 2022 ðŸ˜±]
    • Ulysses (MacOS)
    • StackEdit (free, open-source, browser-based)
    • Google Docs add-on
    • VSCode (free, Markdown extensions)

Written with StackEdit.
